noun.description: The action of taking up or making use of something that is available.
examples: the country's uptake of electronic banking technology

phrases: It is beyond ridiculous to wait four hours in line to process a simple application, merely because the counter clerk is not quick on the uptake, and is unable to process work at a reasonable speed.
You're not too quick on the uptake, but you have a heart of gold.
Cricket has been slow on the uptake to see what mental practice can do.
He has an eagle eye for detail and is quick on the uptake.
I think we all know by now that I'm a little slow on the uptake.
